intro: Villarsia trachysperma, commonly known as the rough-seeded villarsia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds with a rough surface. Villarsia trachysperma is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and endemic status.
